rComments: Great professor, easy homework assignments, kinda sarcastic at times but it's funny. I only received a B because I stopped trying, but I did very well on the first midterm and did okay on the final. If you put in some effort, this class is very possible to get an A. The class attendance thins out towards the end of the quarter.

He's nice and very passionate about the subject that he teaches in lecture and sometimes brings up about his family and daughter. His syllabus states that there is no homework for this class but requires you to practice. He tries to be funny and his lectures are very confusing and his handwriting is small and unclear. The TA's are somewhat helpful.

I didn't go to class- pretty much learned everything out of the book. Discussion sections are mandatory. He posts practice midterms and finals that are a pretty good marker of what the actual tests will look like which was nice. The midterm and quizzes were fair but the final was pretty tough.

Ton of material. He even covered graduate-level material. First midterm was so brutal he lets us retake part of it at home. The class was unpredictable too. He jumped around from topic to topic, and doesn't give early review problems/answers. However, he does love math, and is very helpful. Generous curve too. B average test/quiz, A in the class.

Professor Morris is not your normal professor to say the least. He has a passion for his students to understand the material and not just "recall" it. His tests are intended to put your problem solving skills to the test. It is very doable! I felt like I was going to get a C the whole quarter, and with his curve I got an A!

Very difficult class with a very generous curve. Professor has extremely high expectations, but they are not unreasonable. Do not focus on cramming examples and formulas. To perform well on his exams make sure you have a good grasp on the topics and materials. Also make sure you brush up on your multivariable calculus and linear algebra skills.

The whole time you think you'll get a C or fail because he's hard. But then you realize he curves A LOT. I got a 69 on my midterm, 75 on my final, and an A- average on my quizzes, and my final grade was an A.

This class seems hard while you are taking it, but its not that bad. Easy lab, quizzes are not too bad, tests are hard but curved. I never did the (optional) homework, got a B average on the quizzes, C average on the tests, and ended up with an A in the class. Robin is really nice and a pretty good lecturer considering the material :)

Posts lectures online. Lab is easy. Non-pop Quizzes in class. Tests are really hard and based on practice tests. Curves super low (I think he uses Z scores. Homework doesn't really help, just know the concepts. The textbook was the most useful I've ever had (READ IT). 95% average on quizzes, 70% on midterm, 75% on final A in the class.

Robin is a great teacher. He's very nice in office hours and in lecture. I used the book a lot. The topics are manageable and I did enjoy the class but  Robin manages to make the tests just soo hard. I got a 30 on the first midterm, C's  on the quizes and I don't even know how I did on the final. I still passed :D so i'm happy

Nice guy, I liked his humor but is poor at teaching. Handwriting is illegible at times. The material itself is pretty easy, but somehow he manages to make things difficult in his exams. Make sure to get high quiz scores. Huge Curve at the end. I failed the midterm miserably 39%, kept around a 78% in quizzes, got an 81% on final. A in the class.

Robin is a nice guy if you share the same sense of humor as him. The materials he present are challenging in the sense that they require you to go beyond just memorizing formulas and chugging numbers. Pay attention to his notes and study regularly on your own.

This class was not worth the stress it causes. The only thing that kept me sane was the curve. He's not a bad guy, just can't teach. FYI get ready for a lot of cookie, hurricane, and soda bottle examples.

Guy was super chill. His lectures were pretty simple and easy to understand. Definitely recommend reading the book either before or directly after lecture to tie up loose ends. You should aim to know the material completely, and DONT STUDY FOR THE TEST. Focus on learning.

His lectures are vague and sometimes difficult to follow. Goes really fast!! Always uses those dumb cookie examples. Don't get why this class is called BIOstatistics. Tests are insanely hard. Most fail the tests. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS with Morris.

Robin is a great professor.  He's funny and entertaining, and you can tell he really enjoys what he teaches.  His tests can be difficult because he makes you think about how to apply what you've learned.  Practice problems really help, along with reading the book.  I enjoyed the challenge of the class and managed to get an A.

The entire class is based on tests. NOTHING ELSE. First quiz was easy. Failed the rest of the quizzes, midterm and final even with studying like crazy. Optional homework is NOTHING like the test questions and really doesn't prepare you. Generous, nice, smart teacher but not worth the stress of failing all quarter then ending up with a B+
Really hard class, midterm and final were really hard, failed the final with a 20%, got 50% on the midterm and ended up with a B! curves a lot!

Robin is a funny guy. He has an accent! And yes he gives out cookies. But none of this makes the class worth the torment. Starts easy and gets difficult really fast. Optional homework from the book will help with quizes. Midterm average was very low. Final was miserable. Curve is the only thing that makes it possible to pass. I failed everything: B

A very intelligent man, Robin knows what he's talking about. He's clear on the expectations and makes it clear that the class won't be easy. Having taken it I can say it wasn't easy because all his exams require in depth knowledge of the subject. He curves like a mad man though so you should be fine.
No Comments

Tends to be sarcastic. Tries to win you over by bringing cookies on three different occasions to collect statistical data. Tests are difficult. Midterm 1 average = 47%. He even takes pride in his really hard tests. Confidence was shot down. Hoping to do well on the final.

Great professor, if you go to class, do the hw, you will succeed without the curve, but the curve is nice lol.  Class is interesting, you don't really have to read the book if u go to class, but you should do the assigned problems and practice tests.  Those people who said he's hard probably didn't do the hw.

Class is pretty easy if you grasp the concepts down, reading his notes helps a lot if you manage to read it (it is legible though).  He's funny and extremely helpful.  Exams are kinda tough, but he curves the class.  He even told us to rate him on this website.  Overall a good class and professor.

Nice Guy.  Good math teacher.  I think a lot of your success in this class depends on your TA and your math aptitude.  Nevertheless, it's a solid class, not boring as hell.  He even brought the class cookies.... twice!

I took this class for just the GE and I thought it was really hard. I always went to lecture and I just copied down the notes and didn't really get it. I failed both the final and the midterm, did ok on quizzes and ended up with a C. Sections are mandatory. Nice guy, really loves stats. Has an english accent and really illegible handwriting!
Never really understood the material that was taught. Went to all lecture and just copy notes and sleep. Went to all section. Had like an overall 80% and got an A-. What else can I say?
Funny guy, good teacher. Just study and stats is a difficult subject so be prepared to think. I got a b on my midterm and a d+ on final. go to section and you can get an A

He is a witty Englishman, very enjoyable.  He tries hard to keep the class interesting and does a good job at it.  His tests are tricky, but he curves heavily. If you're reading this you probably have to take AMS 5 for some other class anyway. So know this: the formulas are easy, but knowing when to apply them is harder. Know the concepts.

Practice finals did not resemble the final? Wtf? Questions are very hard to understand, gotta put a lot of time into them. Class boring, very boring. Material was ok. Got a 70% overall hoping for a good curve.

I think he pretty much tried his best! His class might be a little difficult, but he gives curves! I believe 80% is an A- or A for his class. However, I didn't learn much in his class, but I think his class is alright=]
he knows his stuff but you probably wont learn anything unless your really into it because its way hard

Great teacher! Class not so interesting but he knows his stuff! This is a hard class so you need to study! Weekly quizzes help with staying on task. Tests are extremely difficult. Dont think you can just get by with a little bit of studying. TAs and MSI were crap..go to his office hours, he's great!

I found the topic rather boring, but when I payed attention he explained things very clearly.  I enjoyed his sense of humor, but he could also be rude at times.  The curve is useful; my 80 percent was an A.

all i can say is i took stats ap in highscool and got an A. i tried so hard in this class, studied did the homework went to section and went to the extra tutoring sessions. it's not good when your class curve is 55=B. and even with that curve i'm pretty sure i failed. made my quarter miserable, and i've never felt so defeated by a class.

Morris is great. He's intelligent, down to earth, and approachable. The class is very difficult, but I went to his office hours and he was very encouraging. TAs were terrible, sections were useless, and the MSI tutor was terrible. A lot of studying on your own, and what you put in, you get back. Good teacher, slight sense of humor.
Dude looks like Keith Morris. YEAH!

Professor Morris is probably one of the best teachers at UCSC. This was an absolutely amazing class. The course is very challenging and requires a great deal of work outside the class. Section is mandatory and the weekly quizzes are difficult and are more like tests than quizzes. Midterm and final are difficult, but you are allowed a cheat sheet.
The moment he offered the class cookies, I thought to myself, "this man is alright?.  Very well played Mister Morris, I tip my hat to you.
Pretty good professor, he sure loves statistics!  He is really nice and helpful, but you will have to work hard to get a good grade.  TAs were absolutely horrible and so was the book.

Mr. Morris is a very bright and kind man. Very helpful in Office hours. My T.A. was amazing, the other two were not. The class is pretty hard, and he makes you work for your grade. I probably have spent a good 15 hours outside of class studying per week on this class and I will probably scrape by with an A-. Biggest problem: book is not very good.
